DOC.brief_title: Antenatal Testing Obese Woman , Really Necessary ?
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . Purpose : To determine antenatal test improves outcomes obese pregnant woman 2 . Rationale : It well establish obese pregnant woman increase risk stillbirth compare match non obese control . This relative risk increase increase gestational age obese woman increase severity obesity . The increase risk stillbirth lead obstetrician begin antenatal test obese woman ; however , little evidence antenatal fetal surveillance improve outcomes . 3 . Study/Project Population : Pregnant woman 32 week gestation initial BMI > 30kg/m2 4 . Research Design : Randomized Controlled Trial 5 . Study/Project Procedures : Patients randomize one three group : daily kick count , nonstress test , amniotic fluid index , daily kick count , biophysical profile daily kick count . These patient randomly assign group 1:1:1 ratio use random number generator available online . Patients assign daily kick count group call weekly ensure daily kick count . If noncompliant , remove study undergo nonstress test meet initial BMI criterion standard practice institution . 6 . Outcomes Measured : Stillbirth , induction labor , mode delivery , neonatal intensive care unit admission , AGPARs < 7 5 minute life
DOC.criteria: less 32 week gestation BMI > 30kg/m2 English speaking age < 18 age > 45 medical comorbidity require antenatal test obesity unwilling consent NonEnglish speaking pregnant Gestational age > 32 week
